results.title: Dawn
results.creator_credit: Aquataurus Film Productions, Joy Cavill and Ken Hannam
results.brief_description: Story of Australian swimmer Dawn Fraser. Dramatised biographical account of her life and times, and her acclaim as the first female athlete to win gold medals in three successive Olympic Games.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Aquataurus Film Productions, Joy Cavill and Ken Hannam

results.title: Dawn
results.creator_credit: Central Independent Television (UK), WGBH (Boston), Nihon Hoso Kyokai, David Espar and Alice Markowitz
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “The Nuclear age”.
This program examines the background of the decision to drop the atomic bomb on Hiroshima on August 6, 1945. It was a decision which shocked and profoundly changed the world, killing and mutilating thousands. There were mixed reactions of pride and horror. “We had calculated beforehand how much destruction there would be. But seeing it on films was much more terrible.” was one reaction of the time. The pilot was given a hero’s welcome, a medal and a celebration party.

results.title: Davy Jones' locker
results.brief_description: From the animated series “Willie Whopper’s Adventures”, the story of Willie Whopper, a little boy with a big imagination. Willie tangles with denizens of the deep, including a vast and menacing Poseidon figure and a drunken pirate (Davy Jones), who swills hooch while slamming his peg-leg stump on the deck of his room. Lots of sea-creature sight gags, too.

results.title: Davy Crockett: king of the wild frontier
results.creator_credit: Walt Disney Productions, Bill Walsh and Norman Foster
results.brief_description: Davy Crockett was a legendary folk hero. Starring Fess Parker as Crockett, the hero fights alligators, battles an Indian Chief in a savage tomahawk duel and fights for freedom at the ill-fated Alamo. Accompanied by his friend George Russell, played by Buddy Ebsen, “Davy Crockett” is a daring adventure of drama, humour and excitement and will remain a colourful portrayal of the frontier.

results.title: Davis Cup, 1956
results.creator_credit: Ampol Petroleum Ltd and Peter Whitchurch
results.brief_description: Edited action footage of all the matches in the 1956 David Cup Final between Australia and USA. Australia won all matches to make it its 13th Davis Cup victory and was represented by Lew Hoad and Ken Rosewall and USA by Victor Seixas, Herbert Flam and Sam Giammalva. Contains footage of historical interest including Robert Menzies in various spectator shots, Harry Hopman receiving Davis cup from Richard Nixon, then Vice President, for 1955 victory.

results.title: Davidsbundlertanze
results.brief_description: Schumann’s cycle of 28 short pieces for the piano written in 1837, has been choreographed by George Balanchine in 1980. The pieces concerns the composers own life, his love for his wife, his war on the critics of the day, and the conflict of the personalities within his own mind. This brilliant production of this moving piece is performed by the principal members of the New York City Ballet.

results.title: David Wright: stained glass
results.creator_credit: Victorian Film Corporation, Nina Syme and Terry McMahon
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Craft as a Livelihood”.
David Wright originally studied architecture before stained glass attracted his full-time attention. He finds inspiration for his work from those things in nature that are not visible to the naked eye and likes to be completely responsible for a piece, from design to installation.

results.title: David Williamson
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australian playwrights speak”.
Without a question Australia’s most popular and successful playwright is David Williamson. He has analysed and mythologised Australia in thirteen professionally performed plays.

results.title: David to the Rescue
results.creator_credit: Micheline Charest, Ronald A Weinberg and Ernest Reid
results.brief_description: David is always ready to help his fellow creatures out of trouble - but that usually leads him into adventure. “David to the Rescue” - David goes to Italy to attend a sick Gnome child. Finding the healing flower is a challenge which only he can handle. “The Baby Troll” - A baby Troll is stuck on a rock in the middle of the river. David must call upon a friend to help save him.

results.title: David Oistrakh: remembering a musician
results.brief_description: Filmed in the Soviet Union in 1982, this is a biographical documentary on the life of the great Russian violinist David Oistrakh. Odessa, the place of Oistrakh’s birth in 1908, was also to be the city of his official debut in 1926. However it was not until 1933 before he appeared in Moscow and the following year that he was appointed a professor at the Moscow Conservatory. Travelling the world, performing concert after concert David Oistrakh, at the age of 66, died in 1974 in Amsterdam. The film uses stills, archival footage, excerpts from various performances, interviews and includes images of Odessa and Leningrad. In Russian and English with English narration by Erick Friedman.
